Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a laden camel (?) or possibly a horse/donkey and rider. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating and pink paint. Finger prints on interior. Red-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A small number of camel figures were found at Naukratis, all from different mould series (Brussels, Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire A.1834; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.927; 88.1029; Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.6.1899; Gutch 1899, 96, no. 337). Camel figures are usually dated to the Roman period, with a number of parallels from Egypt (Kaufmann 1915, Fig.116; Fischer 1994, no.1115, see also 1116; Dunand 1990, nos. 831). Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen. Wasmuth. Kaufmann, C. M. 1915, Greco-ägyptische Koroplastik. Terrakotten der griechisch-römischen und koptischen Epoche aus der Faijûm-Oase und andren Fundstätten, Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.272) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
